p: Under FA conditions, both species had their lowest ratios at 20 °C and the ratio was increased at higher and lower temperatures (Table 2), with this effect being greater in the slow-growing B. erectus (Fig. 1d). The pattern of response changed markedly at low nitrogen supply with both species showing a significant (1.7 fold) increase in C:N ratio. In response to temperature, the slow-growing B. erectus showed a more mixed response with a marked increase (60%) at 30 °C and a decline (10%) at 7 °C . The fast-growing B. hordeaceus had higher ratios overall with a steady decline with a rise in temperature.
